snippet.title: A: Strange query behaviour in OWL!
snippet.description: The reason why the 2nd query "does not work" is Open World Assumption, and possibly also (the lack of) Unique Name Assumption. Say you state: John lives in Paris. Mary lives in Paris … . The following questions are answered in the following way by an OWL reasoner. Who lives in Paris? John, Mary Does at least one thing live in Paris? YES Do at least two things live in Paris? Maybe Is Paris …

snippet.title: A: Behaviour of List<T>.Sort in .NET 4.5 changed from .NET 4.0?
snippet.description: assumptions about what order equivalent elements come in. In contrast, Linq's OrderBy method performs a stable sort.
